page.title: 01LOWER BOCKHAMPTON
page.content:
{ Lower Bockhampton}is a small village just above the {R.Frome. }About 65 people live in its 20 or so cottages. Many of the houses are original 14th Century, but a few larger houses were built in the 1950's. There used to be a post office, but the building is now a dwelling. There is a tea house which is a 1950's copy of a 14th Century cottage, adjacent to the public call box.
{West of Lower Bockhampton}are fields owned by the Ministry of Agriculture college at{Kingston Maurward.} These are used to graze animals.
{East of Lower Bockhampton}is Bhompston Farm, which has 120 acres of grazing land on the water meadows of the{ {R.Frome.}They keep 100 head of beef cattle.
